Question: A man needs to transport a wolf, a goat, and a cabbage across a river.
He has a small boat that can only carry himself and one item at a time.
If left unattended together, the wolf would eat the goat, and the goat would eat the cabbage.

How can the man transport all three items across the river without any of them being eaten?

The tricky part is that if the wolf and the goat are left together, the wolf will eat the goat, and if the goat and the cabbage are left together, the goat will eat the cabbage.
I need to figure out a way for the man to get all three across without any of them getting eaten.
First, I'll try to break down the problem.
The man can only take one item with him at a time, so he has to make multiple trips.
